Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.ViewManager
public class ViewManager extends Object
Manages the visibility and state transitions of different UI screens and menus.

This class serves as a centralized controller for showing and hiding various UI components, ensuring that only the appropriate screens are visible at any time.

Functionality:

  • Controls visibility of main menu, game screens, and overlays
  • Manages transitions between different UI states
  • Handles pause menu, game over screen, and leaderboard display
  • Provides null-safe visibility toggling for all components

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewManager

      public ViewManager(javafx.scene.layout.VBox homeMenu, javafx.scene.layout.VBox howToPlayMenu, javafx.scene.layout.VBox themesMenu, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane gameBoard, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.VBox leftSidebar, javafx.scene.layout.VBox rightSidebar, javafx.scene.layout.VBox pauseMenu, javafx.scene.layout.VBox gameOverPanel, javafx.scene.Group groupNotification, javafx.scene.layout.VBox leaderMenu, javafx.scene.control.Label timerLabel)
      Constructs a ViewManager with references to all managed UI components.
      Parameters:
      homeMenu - the main menu VBox
      howToPlayMenu - the how-to-play instructions VBox
      themesMenu - the theme selection menu VBox
      gameBoard - the main game board StackPane
      brickPanel - the GridPane containing game bricks
      leftSidebar - the left sidebar VBox
      rightSidebar - the right sidebar VBox
      pauseMenu - the pause menu overlay VBox
      gameOverPanel - the game over screen VBox
      groupNotification - the notification group for score popups
      leaderMenu - the leaderboard display VBox
      timerLabel - the timer label for time attack mode

  • Method Details

    • setState

      public void setState(UIState newState)
      Transitions to a new UI state.

      Automatically handles showing and hiding appropriate UI components based on the target state.

      Parameters:
      newState - the UIState to transition to

    • showHome

      public void showHome()
      Shows the home menu and hides all other components.

      This is the default starting state of the application.

    • showHowToPlay

      public void showHowToPlay()
      Shows the how-to-play instructions screen.

      Hides the home menu and other non-relevant components.

    • showThemes

      public void showThemes()
      Shows the theme selection menu.

      Hides the home menu and other non-relevant components.

    • showGame

      public void showGame()
      Shows the main game interface with all gameplay components.

      Hides all menu screens and overlays.

    • showPause

      public void showPause()
      Shows the pause menu overlay.

      Game components remain visible but dimmed behind the pause menu.

    • showGameOver

      public void showGameOver()
      Shows the game over screen.

      Displays the final score and game over options.

    • showLeaderboard

      public void showLeaderboard()
      Shows the leaderboard display.

      Can be shown from either menu or game states.

    • hideLeaderboard

      public void hideLeaderboard()
      Hides the leaderboard display.

      Returns to the previous state.
